result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Tyler Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
Good time.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Work out payment plan with agent.
Work out payment plan with agent.
Work out payment plan with agent.

Follow through with counseling assessments and treatment as determined by agent, including Anger Management and Parenting classes.
Defendant ordered to report to Marinette County Jail today for fingerprints.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Andrew Tyler Mitchell in court.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Copy of comp

Fact basis
Court finds def guilty
ADA spks on sentencing
Court imposes:  Imposed & Stayed 30 days jail, good time, huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.  
1 year probation.  Conditions:
Fine $100 + costs + $200 DNA surcharge + $200 GPS surcharge + $72 service fees = $951.00; work out payment plan with agent.
Follow through with counseling assessments and treatment as determined by agent, including Anger Management and Parenting classes.

If def wants atty must go see the PD
If def does not have completed forms or atty at next hearing, Court will revoke bond
